qas.question: Which race was growing faster after the First World War?

answers.text: the Northern Territory Protector of Natives,

context: After the First World War, however, it became apparent that the number of <a0_0>mixed-race people<a0_0/> was growing at a faster rate than the white population, and by 1930 fear of the <a1_0>"half-caste menace"<a1_0/> undermining <a2_0>the White Australia ideal<a2_0/> from within was being taken as a serious concern. <a3_0>Dr. Cecil Cook<a3_0/>, <a4_0>the Northern Territory Protector of Natives,<a4_0/> noted that:
